intro: Oxybasis, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the mallow family, Malvaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States and northern Mexico. Oxybasis species are typically shrubs or subshrubs with thick, succulent stems and palmate leaves. They produce showy, five-petaled flowers that are usually pink, purple, or white. The genus is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments due to its drought-resistant adaptations.
